title: Elle Programming Language
description: A modern Lisp interpreter with bytecode compilation, pattern matching, and FFI

content.text: Elle is a **modern Lisp interpreter** designed for clarity, performance, and expressiveness. It combines the elegance of Lisp with practical features like bytecode compilation, pattern matching, and seamless FFI integration.
Whether you're building command-line tools, data processing pipelines, or exploring functional programming, Elle provides a clean, powerful foundation.

items: **Bytecode Compilation** — Programs are compiled to bytecode for efficient execution
**Lisp Syntax** — Elegant, homoiconic syntax with full metaprogramming support
**First-Class Functions** — Closures, higher-order functions, and functional composition
**Immutable Data Structures** — Lists, vectors, and persistent data structures
**Mutable Collections** — Tables and structs for when you need state
**File I/O** — Comprehensive file and directory operations
**JSON Support** — Native JSON parsing and serialization
**Module System** — Load and compose code with `import-file`

content.text: Here's a simple Elle program that demonstrates core features:

;; Define a function to calculate factorial
(define factorial
  (lambda (n)
    (if (<= n 1)
      1
      (* n (factorial (- n 1))))))

;; Use it
(display "5! = ")
(display (factorial 5))
(newline)
This program defines a recursive factorial function and prints the result. Elle handles the recursion efficiently with tail-call optimization.
Ready to dive in? Start with the [Getting Started](getting-started.html) guide to install Elle and write your first program.
Then explore the [Language Guide](language-guide.html) to learn about Elle's data types, control flow, and advanced features.
